titles.title: Gekijouban Sidonia no Kishi
극장판 시도니아의 기사
劇場版 シドニアの騎士
Knights of Sidonia: The Movie

anime.description: The year is 3394. The solar system has been long destroyed by a strange alien race called Gauna. Now humans are barely maintaining population in their seed ships - the ones they also used to escape a thousand years ago. After several years of drifting though space, Sidonia, a seed ship with a population of over 500,000 people, is once again threatened by Gauna. Follow http://anidb.net/ch61369 [Tanikaze Nagate], a mysterious young man from the deep corners of the ship, and his friends as they try to strike back against these gigantic creatures and at the same time learn what they really are for the sake of humanity`s survival. Source: MAL Note: The film is a compilation of all 12 episodes of the first season with new sequences and redone sound effects.

tag.name: seinen
tag.description: Seinen, literally "young man", is one of the main demographic classifications applied to manga, and, by extension, to anime, especially manga-based ones. As the name implies, seinen works are marketed primarily to an audience of young men; the age range commonly understood to be the target of such works goes roughly from 17 to somewhere in the 40s.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

character.name: Samari Ittan
character.description: A female pilot appointed as leader during their deployment. Her skill and popularity are unmatched, and she`s very popular with the male pilots. More than a few of them want to photosynthesize with Samari, but she doesn`t let it bother her. Source: ANN

character.name: Hiyama Lalah
character.description: Dorm mother of the pilot dorms. She`s a bear-type dorm mother in charge of running the dorm for pilots and cadets. She`s usually very nice, but she gets mad when people call her by her first name, Lalah, and her wild instincts are let loose. Source: ANN

character.name: Seii Ichirou
character.description: Commands the Guardian squads under Captain Kobayashi. Source: ANN

character.name: Kobayashi Kanchou
character.description: The mysterious young female captain of the Sidonia spaceship who commands the Guardians into attacking the enemy Gauna aliens. Known to most just as The 28th Generation Captain, her face appears concealed behind a Japanese Kabuki mask most of the time. Source: Wiki

character.name: Yamano Eiko
character.description: Guardian Pilot Cadet, 628th generation. A studious young woman, who achieved her position as a cadet through hard work, so she holds some antagonism towards Nagate and Izana who got their assignments under special conditions. Source: ANN

character.name: Kunato Norio
character.description: Guardian Pilot Cadet, 628th generation. Cadet Training Unit ID# TS 岐(Ku) - 001. His skills are extremely fine, and he prides himself as one of the top cadets. He`s also to become the 8th generation heir to Kunato Developments, and is extremely proud. He discriminates against Nagate and Izana, considering them sub-humans, and doesn`t think too well of the fact that Nagate is the one piloting the hero`s Guardian, Tsugumori. Source: ANN

character.name: Midorikawa Yuhata
character.description: Midorikawa Yuhata suddenly transfers into the Guardian Pilot Training Academy`s 628th generation. Her older brother is a member of Sidonia`s most distinguished and strongest Guardian unit, the Akai squad. Her hobby is building plastic models of Guardians. Source: ANN

character.name: Ochiai
character.description: Captain`s Assistant. Aide to Captain Kobayashi and the young man responsible for Nagate`s care. Source: ANN

character.name: Tanikaze Nagate
character.description: The series main protagonist who was created by his grandfather deep inside Sidonia, thus he did not underwent the special genetic treatment to develop the ability to perform photosintesis and must eat on a daily basis like a regular human for nutrition. Despite having a hard time adapting to Sidonia`s way of life and getting in trouble constantly while being rejected by the other humans due to not being aware of the laws and attributes of the new culture, he eventually becomes the spaceship`s ace pilot after saving the day on several missions. Source: Wiki

character.name: Honoka Ren
character.description: One of the eleven Honoka sisters who are all Guardian pilots. They are long haired albino females who appear identical due to being human clones. Source: Wiki

character.name: Honoka En
character.description: One of the eleven Honoka sisters who are all Guardian pilots. They are long haired albino females who appear identical due to being human clones. Source: Wiki

character.name: Honoka Hou
character.description: One of the eleven Honoka sisters who are all Guardian pilots. They are long haired albino females who appear identical due to being human clones. Source: Wiki

character.name: Fushi no Sen`in-kai
character.description: The Immortal Ship Committee is a group of individuals aboard the Sidonia who are deemed essential to the ship`s mission and are kept alive indefinitely with biotechnology. Starting about 600 years before the beginning of the story, the core members of the Immortal Ship Committee - Kobayashi, Hiyama, Saitou, and Ochiai - began taking drugs that made them immune to aging and disease. As time went on, more members were added to the Committee until, one hundred years before the storyline, there were 25 members of the Immortal Ship Committee. They were led by Kobayashi, and had the ultimate goal of delivering Sidonia to a safe and habitable star system. While some members of the Immortal Ship Committee live in the flesh, most of them live inside mechanical shells that protect their bodies from the diseases of aging. These members are unnamed, but appear to be the actual committee (also called the Assembly) members that make decisions for Sidonia. Their real names are not given and they are referred to by numbers. The only visible portion of their body are their faces, which are covered by skeletal masks and hide their youthful appearance. Physically, the members of the Immortal Ship Committee look as if they were in their late twenties. Fearing for the survival of Sidonia, they try to remove Captain Kobayashi from her position, with Member #5 presenting himself as the next captain. However, shortly after he does so, the clone Ochiai kills him and every other member of the committee present. After the murder of the committee members, only six immortals remain on Sidonia. Source: wikia
